task.title: Installing the Plant Applications Message Bridge
task.shortdesc: You must install the Message Bridge on the server node to access the real-time updates on the applications in the .

taskbody.prereq: GE recommends that the Message Bridge is installed before installing the .
taskbody.context:
The Message Bridge installer installs the following prerequisites:
Erlang OTP
RabbitMQ ServerIf the Message Bridge is currently installed, do not reinstall the Message Bridge. You can verify whether the Message Bridge is installed in the Programs and Features list on your computer as shown in the following image.

step.cmd: Select the Plant Applications Message Bridge wizard, and, on the welcome screen, select Next to install the Message Bridge.
step.stepresult: The Missing Prerequisites screen appears, listing any prerequisites that must be installed.

step.cmd: In the Missing Prerequisites screen, select Continue to install any missing prerequisites.
step.stepresult: The Read and accept the license agreement to continue screen appears.

step.cmd: Read the license agreement, select Accept, and then select Next to continue the installation.
step.stepresult: The Microsoft SQL Server Credentials screen appears.

step.cmd: In the Microsoft SQL Server Credentials screen, enter the credentials to access the Microsoft SQL server as described in the following table.

chrow.chdesc: Enter the host name where the Microsoft SQL server is installed in the format HOST_NAME\INSTANCE, where HOST_NAME is the host name (either a fully qualified domain name or IP address, of the server), and INSTANCE is the instance of the server.
Enter the name of the database that you want to connect with the .
Enter the user name that has permissions to access the database you entered in the Database box. By default, the user name appears as sa.
Enter the password for the user you entered in the User box.
Enter the name of the instance of the SQL server. Entering an instance is optional.
Enter the number of the port that the instance uses to listen for client connections.

step.cmd: Select Validate Connection to validate the database connection.
step.stepresult: If the database connection is successfully validated, the Next button is enabled.
The RabbitMQ Administrator Account Credentials screen appears.

step.cmd: In the RabbitMQ Administrator Account Credentials section, enter the user name and password for an existing RabbitMQ Administrator, if RabbitMQ is already installed. Else, provide the user name and password you intend to use as an administrator.

In the Plant Applications Administrator Account Credentials section, enter the user name and password for an administrator account in , and then select Validate Connection to validate the credentials.
step.stepresult: If the credentials are successfully validated, the Next button is enabled.
The You are ready to install screen appears.

step.cmd: Select Install to install all the prerequisites and the Message Bridge.
step.info: Depending on the options selected, the installation process may take some time. The installer displays the status updates.
step.stepresult: On successful installation, the Installation Successful screen appears.

step.cmd: Select View Logs to see the installation details.
In the Installation Successful screen, select Exit to close the wizard.

taskbody.result: The Message Bridge is successfully installed on your computer.
taskbody.postreq:
After you install the Message Bridge, complete the following procedure to enable the Proficy Server Manager service to pass messages between the :
Configure your Administrator user in RabbitMQ. For more information, refer to the topic.
Restart the Proficy Server Manager service to automatically start the Proficy Server Message Bridge service.
The Proficy Server Message Bridge service allows messages to pass between the clients.
